Analysis of Charipinae distribution patterns in Great Britain (Hymenoptera: Cynipoidea: Figitidae)
Conference Paper
Full-text available
  • Jan 2014
  • Mar Ferrer-Suay
  • Jesús Selfa
  • David G. Notton

Assessment of the distribution and abundance of the mason bee species Osmia bicornis and Osmia cornuta in specifically chosen natural and semi-natural habitats of Spain by means of systematic trap nesting (SPIN-OFF Universitat de Valencia - WBP))
Archived project
Solitary bees, and mason bees in particular (Megachilidae), have been revealed in several studies as effective and reliable pollinators in certain crops such as almonds, cherries, apples, pears and other Rosaceae fruit trees. However, the natural abundance of these solitary bees in agricultural ecosystems can be low due to the lack of adequate nesting opportunities. Furthermore, abundance of Osmia in many orchards is still poorly known in Mediteranean areas. We aim to assess the distribution and abundance of the mason bee species Osmia bicornis and Osmia cornuta in specifically chosen natural and semi-natural habitats of Spain by means of systematic trap nesting. Particular attention will be paid to almond orchards, one of the host plant of Osmia bees. The study will be carried out by placing trap-nests in the chosen areas and then by analysing Osmia nesting abundance and nesting patterns.
